intro: Cousinia shibarensis, commonly known as the Japanese cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Cousinia shibarensis is often found in alpine and coastal regions, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
